Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, which was found at Oxyrhynchus (P. Oxy.IV 710),  carries many different payments to the employees of the royal post, which included "carriers of documents" and a cameldriver. It is one of the rare Ptolemaic testimonies of the camel in Africa.
